topic: Terminid: Bile Titan Complete Weakness Guide
summary: Comprehensive guide to defeating Bile Titans. The forehead plate is the most critical weak point (1500 HP) that results in instant kill when destroyed. The belly sacs (4000 HP) can disable acid attacks when destroyed. Timing and positioning are crucial for success.

weak_points.name: Forehead Plate
weak_points.location: Center of the head, glowing orange plate
weak_points.notes: Primary weak point. Destroying this results in instant kill. Vulnerable window when rearing up to spit.
weak_points.timing: Best targeted when Bile Titan is stationary or rearing up for acid attack

weak_points.name: Green Belly Sacs
weak_points.location: Two large green sacs on the underside
weak_points.notes: Destroying both sacs disables acid spit attack permanently. Less efficient than headshot but safer approach.
weak_points.timing: Target when Bile Titan is moving or when underneath it

recommended_weapons.notes: One-shot kill to forehead plate. Quick deployment and high damage.
One-shot kill to forehead plate. Requires teammate reload for efficiency.
One-shot kill to forehead plate. No ammo concerns but longer charge time.
Can one-shot forehead plate in unsafe mode. Fast firing rate.

recommended_stratagems.notes: Instant kill with direct hit. Best used on stationary targets or spawn points.
Auto-targets largest enemy. Reliable but may not always hit the head.
Sustained damage can kill multiple Bile Titans. Recent damage buff makes it very effective.

tactical_approach.positioning: Maintain distance of 30-40 meters. Use elevation when possible. Avoid standing directly in front.
tactical_approach.timing: Wait for the rearing animation when preparing to spit acid. This exposes the forehead plate clearly.
tactical_approach.team_coordination: Assign one player with anti-tank weapon to focus on Bile Titans while others handle smaller enemies.
common_mistakes: Shooting the mouth during acid spit (mouth is armored during attack)
Standing too close and getting caught in acid pools
Wasting ammo on heavily armored body parts
Not coordinating team fire on single target

summary: Detailed guide for defeating Hulks efficiently. The eye socket is the primary weak point requiring precision weapons. Alternative strategies include leg crippling and weapon arm destruction for tactical advantages.

weak_points.name: Eye Socket
weak_points.location: Narrow red glowing slit on the 'head' area
weak_points.notes: Primary weak point. Very small target requiring precision. Instant kill when destroyed.
weak_points.timing: Best targeted when Hulk is stationary or moving slowly

weak_points.name: Leg Joints
weak_points.location: Hip and knee joint areas on both legs
weak_points.notes: Destroying legs severely reduces mobility. Makes eye targeting much easier.
weak_points.timing: Target when Hulk is moving or turning

weak_points.name: Weapon Arm
weak_points.location: Right arm carrying flamethrower or other weapons
weak_points.notes: Destroys primary weapon threat. Reduces Hulk's offensive capability significantly.
weak_points.timing: Target when Hulk is preparing to attack

recommended_weapons.notes: Perfect for eye shots. 2 shots to disable legs. High precision and penetration.
Versatile against all weak points. Good sustained fire for leg targeting.
One-shot potential to eye in unsafe mode. Fast follow-up shots.

tactical_approach.precision_targeting: Use scope weapons for eye shots. Take time to line up shots rather than spray.
tactical_approach.alternative_strategy: If eye shots are difficult, focus on legs first to immobilize, then target eye on stationary Hulk.
tactical_approach.stun_tactics: Stun Grenades freeze Hulk for 3-4 seconds, providing easy eye shot opportunity.
tactical_approach.positioning: Maintain 40-50 meter distance. Use cover and elevation. Avoid close quarters combat.
tactical_approach.team_coordination: One player focuses on precision shots while others provide covering fire and crowd control.

advanced_strategies.description: Throw Stun Grenade to freeze Hulk, then immediately line up eye shot with precision weapon.
Target both legs with sustained fire to immobilize, then safely target eye.
advanced_strategies.requirements: High-penetration weapon with good ammo capacity

advanced_strategies.description: Destroy weapon arm first to reduce threat, then flank for better eye angle.

hulk_variants.special_notes: Most common variant. Flamethrower has limited range but high damage.
Faster movement. More aggressive melee combat. Same weak points apply.

summary: Advanced strategies for handling Chargers, focusing on armor stripping, rear targeting, and mobility disruption. Multiple approaches for different weapons and team compositions.

weak_points.name: Unarmored Rear
weak_points.location: Back section behind the armored carapace
weak_points.notes: Destroying triggers 7.5 second bleed out. Most reliable weak point for most weapons.
weak_points.timing: Target when Charger has passed by or is turning around

weak_points.name: Head (Armored)
weak_points.notes: Requires anti-tank weapons. One-shot potential but heavily armored.
weak_points.timing: Best when Charger is charging directly at you

weak_points.name: Leg Armor Points
weak_points.location: Six legs, armor can be stripped
weak_points.notes: Strip armor first with AT weapons, then use regular weapons on exposed areas.
optimal_weapons: Anti-tank for stripping, then primary weapons
weak_points.timing: Target legs when Charger is stationary or moving slowly

weapon_specific_strategies.strategy: Focus on rear area. 2-3 grenades typically needed. Safe distance engagement.
Target head/face area. Continuous damage ignores armor durability mechanics.
One-shot to head when charging. Save ammo for multiple Chargers.

topic: Enemy Engagement Priority and General Tactics
summary: Strategic guide for prioritizing threats and managing multiple enemy encounters. Covers target priority, resource management, and team coordination principles.

threat_priority_list.rationale: Highest damage potential, area denial capabilities
threat_priority_list.recommended_response: Immediate anti-tank focus, team coordination required

threat_priority_list.rationale: High damage, mobile threats that can disrupt team positioning
threat_priority_list.recommended_response: Precision weapons or coordinated anti-tank fire

threat_priority_list.rationale: Moderate threat, manageable with appropriate weapons

resource_management.anti_tank_conservation: Reserve AT weapons for Priority 1 and 2 threats. Use alternatives when possible.
resource_management.ammo_efficiency: Target weak points to maximize damage per shot. Avoid shooting armored areas.
resource_management.stratagem_timing: Save powerful stratagems (500kg, Orbital Laser) for multiple high-value targets.
resource_management.team_ammo_sharing: Coordinate supply drops and ammo distribution based on role assignments.

engagement_principles: Always identify weak points before engaging
Maintain appropriate distance for your weapon type
Use terrain and cover to your advantage
Focus fire on single targets rather than spreading damage
Have exit strategy planned before engaging
Coordinate team roles: precision shooter, crowd control, support
